definitions.definition: the invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
air regarded as necessary for breathing.
the free or unconfined space above the surface of the earth.
examples: he celebrated by tossing his hat high in the air
synonyms: ether "hundreds of birds hovered in the air"

definitions.definition: referring to the use of aircraft.
the earth's atmosphere as a medium for transmitting radio waves.
examples: radio stations have successfully sold products over the air

definitions.definition: air considered as one of the four elements in ancient philosophy and in astrology (associated with the signs of Gemini, Aquarius, and Libra).

synonyms: gust of wind "open the windows to get some air into the room"

definitions.definition: a jump off the ground on a snowboard.
an impression of a quality or manner given by someone or something.
examples: she answered with a faint air of boredom

definitions.definition: an annoyingly affected and condescending manner.
a tune or short melodious composition, typically a song.
examples: tune, melody, song; lay a traditional Scottish air
a meeting in which long-standing grievances were aired
synonyms: give expression/voice to; have one's say about "a chance to air your views"

definitions.definition: broadcast (a program) on radio or television.
examples: the programs were aired on India's state TV network
airing a snowy hand and signet ring

definitions.definition: expose (a room) to the open air in order to ventilate it.
examples: the window sashes were lifted regularly to air the room
synonyms: cool "the windows were opened to air the room"

definitions.definition: go out in the fresh air.
